title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (http://contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: Zheng B (2025). rtiddlywiki: R Interface 'TiddlyWiki'. R package version 0.5.0, https://rtiddlywiki.bangyou./.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rtiddlywiki: R Interface for 'TiddlyWiki'},   author = {Bangyou Zheng},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.5.0},   url = {https://rtiddlywiki.bangyou.me/}, }

title: R Interface for TiddlyWiki
text: R interface tiddlywiki unique non-linear notebook capturing, organising sharing complex information.

what: Communicate with WebServer API for node.js only
title: R Interface for TiddlyWiki
text: WebServer APIs tiddlywiki implemented R interface including GET list tiddlers filters, tiddler, file; PUT new tiddler.
code: tw_options(host = "http://127.0.0.1:8080/") # Get all tiddlers get_tiddlers() # Get a tiddler by title  get_tiddler(title = "GettingStarted")  # Put a new tiddler  title <- "New tiddler" text <- c("!! Section",           "This is a new tiddler") type <- "text/vnd.tiddlywiki" tags <- c("Tag1", "Tag 2") fields <- c("field 1" = "value 1", "field 2" = "field 2") put_tiddler(title = title,              text = text,             type = type,              tags = tags,             fields = fields)

what: Generate markdown tiddler from Rmarkdown file
title: R Interface for TiddlyWiki
text: new output format tiddler_document exported generate markdown tiddler Rmarkdown file PUT tiddlywiki WebServer. image files generated knitr embeded base64. Lazy load Node.js can used load big markdown file. host tiddlywiki server can configured Environment variable TW_HOST (e.g. .Renviron) using tw_options(host = "http://<host>:<port>/"). method working local remote tiddlywiki node.js server without authentication. rtiddlywiki support basic authentication now. new tiddler json format generated Rmd folder can used import tiddlywiki server single file. tiddler PUT server host specified environment variable remote sets true yaml header. yaml header can specified export tiddler_document. title Rmarkdown file used tiddler name. markdown file generated functions rmarkdown::md_document bookdown::markdown_document2 use_bookdown specified. preview option used preview markdown file tiddlywiki plugin tw-livebridge installed. open_tiddler command sent websocket server tw-livebridge open tiddler browser, bring generated tiddler view.
code: title: "R Markdown file" output:    rtiddlywiki::tiddler_document:     remote: true     preview: true     tags: ["tag 1", "tag 2"]     fields:       "field1": "V1"       "field 2": "Value 2"

title: R Interface for TiddlyWiki
text: remote tiddlywiki server, use alternative way authentication. nginx server used reverse proxy add header authorization. Environment variables TW_HTTP_X_AUTH_KEY .Renviron used set auth key. example nginx configuration : placeholders (e.g., <your_domain>, <your_path>, <unique key>, <remote_ip>) replaced actual values use.
code: server {     listen 443 ssl;     server_name <your_domain>;      ssl_certificate     <your_path>.crt;     ssl_certificate_key <your_path>.key;     client_max_body_size 100M;     location / {         allow 127.0.0.1;         allow <remote_ip>;         deny all;         if ($http_x_auth_key != '<a unique key>') {             return 403;         }          proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1:8001;         proxy_set_header Host $host;         proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;         proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;         add_header 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' '*';         add_header 'Access-Control-Allow-Methods' 'GET, OPTIONS';         add_header 'Access-Control-Allow-Headers' 'Origin, X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Accept';     }     location /ws {         allow 127.0.0.1;         allow <remote_ip>;         deny all;         if ($http_x_auth_key != '<a unique key>') {             return 403;         }          proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1:8001/ws;         proxy_http_version 1.1;          proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;         proxy_set_header Connection $connection_upgrade;          proxy_set_header Host $host;         proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;         proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;         proxy_read_timeout 3600s;         proxy_send_timeout 3600s;         proxy_connect_timeout 3600s;         proxy_buffering off;     }  }

title: R Interface for TiddlyWiki

what: Create HTML Tabs for Multiple Objects — create_tabs
title: Create HTML Tabs for Multiple Objects — create_tabs
text: function generates tabbed HTML interface displaying multiple R objects `ggplot2` plots data frames. tab can include custom arguments rendering (e.g., image width table formatting).

title: Create HTML Tabs for Multiple Objects — create_tabs
Create HTML Tabs for Multiple Objects — create_tabs
text: ... Named arguments name defines tab label. argument can either: single object (`ggplot`, `data.frame`, etc.) list `object` element additional named arguments passed relevant rendering function.

title: Create HTML Tabs for Multiple Objects — create_tabs
text: `htmltools::tag` object representing full tab interface. Can printed R Markdown documents displayed interactively RStudio Viewer.

title: Create HTML Tabs for Multiple Objects — create_tabs
text: Supported object types: `ggplot` objects — rendered base64-encoded images using `save_base64()` `data.frame` `tibble` — rendered using `kable_html()` Additional arguments passed inside list used relevant rendering function.

title: Create HTML Tabs for Multiple Objects — create_tabs
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(ggplot2)  # Simple plot and table p <- ggplot(cars) + geom_point(aes(speed, dist)) df <- head(cars)  # Basic usage create_tabs(   plot = p,   table = df )  # With custom rendering arguments create_tabs(   plot = list(object = p, width = 4),   table = list(object = df, digits = 2) ) } # }

text: title tiddler title text tiddler text type tiddler type tags tiddler tags merged existing tags fields named vector tiddler fields merged existing tags recipe string defining recipe write (optional, defaults "default")

title: Put a tiddler — put_tiddler
Put a tiddler — put_tiddler
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ title <- "New tiddler" text <- c("!! Section",           "This is a new tiddler") type <- "text/vnd.tiddlywiki" tags <- c("Tag1", "Tag 2") fields <- c("F1" = "V1", "F2" = "V2") put_tiddler(title = title,             text = text,             type = type,             tags = tags,             fields = fields) } # }

what: Read a TiddlyWiki Table into a Data Frame — read_table
title: Read a TiddlyWiki Table into a Data Frame — read_table
text: function parses table written TiddlyWiki format converts R data frame. can optionally treat first row header.

title: Read a TiddlyWiki Table into a Data Frame — read_table
Read a TiddlyWiki Table into a Data Frame — read_table
text: table character string representing TiddlyWiki table. header logical value indicating whether first row treated column headers. Default TRUE.

title: Read a TiddlyWiki Table into a Data Frame — read_table
text: data frame containing parsed table data.

title: Read a TiddlyWiki Table into a Data Frame — read_table
code: table <- "|!Cell1 |!Cell2 |\n|Cell3 |Cell4 |" df <- read_table(table, header = TRUE) print(df) #>   Cell1 Cell2 #> 1 Cell3 Cell4

title: Generate HTML Tabs with Dynamic Content — tabs
Generate HTML Tabs with Dynamic Content — tabs
text: names character vector tab labels. fun function generates content tab. must take index (``) first argument. groupname unique string group radio inputs (default generated automatically). checked index tab pre-selected (default `1`). ... Additional arguments passed `fun`.

title: Generate HTML Tabs with Dynamic Content — tabs
Generate HTML Tabs with Dynamic Content — tabs
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ tab_labels <- c("Tab1", "Tab2", "Tab3")  tab_content_fun <- function(i, extra_text = "") {     htmltools::tagList(         htmltools::tags$p(paste("Content for tab:", tab_labels[i], extra_text)),         htmltools::tags$img(src = paste0("plot_", i, ".png"), width = "100%")     ) }  tabs(tab_labels, tab_content_fun, checked = 2, extra_text = "Additional details") } # }

title: Create a tiddlywiki widget from htmlwidget — tw_widget

code:
library(leaflet) if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ content <- paste(sep = "
", "Samurai Noodle", "606 5th Ave. S", "Seattle, WA 98138" ) widget <- leaflet() %>% addTiles() %>% addPopups(-122.327298, 47.597131, content, options = popupOptions(closeButton = FALSE) ) tw_widget(widget) } # }

what: Convert a Word File to Markdown with Optional Embedded Images — word_to_md
title: Convert a Word File to Markdown with Optional Embedded Images — word_to_md
text: function converts Word (`.docx`) file Markdown using Pandoc. Optionally, embeds images Base64 self-contained Markdown file.

title: Convert a Word File to Markdown with Optional Embedded Images — word_to_md
code: word_to_md(   docx_file,   output_file = NULL,   embed_images = FALSE,   overwrite = FALSE )

title: Convert a Word File to Markdown with Optional Embedded Images — word_to_md
text: docx_file Path input Word file. output_file Path final Markdown output file. null, original file name. embed_images Logical. `TRUE`, images embedded Base64. Default `FALSE`. overwrite Logical. `TRUE`, Output file overwrote. Default `FALSE`

title: Convert a Word File to Markdown with Optional Embedded Images — word_to_md
Convert a Word File to Markdown with Optional Embedded Images — word_to_md
code: # Convert Word to Markdown without embedding images if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ word_to_md("input.docx", "output.md", embed_images = FALSE)  # Convert and embed images as Base64 word_to_md("input.docx", "output_embedded.md", embed_images = TRUE) } # }
